units.title: Pooling PSC lines before organoid generation
units.text: we pooled PSC lines (5,000 cells per line) before organoid generation and longitudinally profiled the resulting mCBOs through scRNA-seq at 50, 100 and 300 d of differentiation, following the same protocol previously used and benchmarked in our laboratory5,11,15.
units.rationale: Creates mosaic organoids that incorporate multiple donor genotypes from the start.

units.title: Generating individual CBOs and pooling post-dissociation
units.text: CBOs were generated individually from the PSC lines and pooled after organoid dissociation for single-cell library preparation.
units.rationale: Enables downstream multiplexing while preserving separate organoid cultures.

units.title: Assessing proliferation via flow cytometry
units.text: we longitudinally assessed the proliferation rate of organoids derived from individual lines in two differentiation replicates through flow cytometry-based cell cycle analysis.
units.rationale: Measures growth dynamics to compare line-specific developmental trajectories.

units.title: Immunofluorescence characterization of mCBOs
units.text: We first characterized mCBOs by immunofluorescence for canonical markers of neurodevelopment previously defined for organoids.
units.rationale: Validates organoid identity and developmental stage before sequencing.

units.title: SCanSNP two‑step classification approach
units.text: SCanSNP (Fig. 3a), to overcome the observed limitations by (1) dividing the classification challenge into two steps, one for identity assignment and one for doublet detection and (2) measuring the genetic purity of each droplet to identify low-quality droplets and separate them from authentic doublets.
units.rationale: Improves genotype assignment and removes artefactual doublets in multiplexed data.

units.title: Benchmarking demultiplexing algorithms on simulated datasets
units.text: In the simulated datasets, all demultiplexing algorithms performed better in balanced cases, and SCanSNP was the most accurate in both balanced and imbalanced settings.
units.rationale: Demonstrates the robustness of SCanSNP across genotype composition scenarios.

units.title: Consensus call framework for genotype identification
units.text: we set a consensus call framework merging their outcomes into one combined output (Fig. 3b).
units.rationale: Combines multiple tools to increase confidence in cell identity calls.

units.title: Modeling scalability of multiplexing combinations
units.text: We modeled the scalability of the system, analyzing different multiplexing combinations with an increasing number of lines.
units.rationale: Predicts how experimental complexity impacts data quality and throughput.

units.title: Evaluating doublet detection performance of SCanSNP and consensus call
units.text: doublets identified by SCanSNP and the consensus call were the only ones for which the average log count distribution of unique molecular identifiers was, as expected, higher than that for singlets (Fig. 3e).
units.rationale: Confirms that these methods accurately flag doublets based on UMI count patterns.

units.title: Demultiplexing using three state‑of‑the‑art algorithms
units.text: single-cell transcriptomics datasets generated from both mosaic and downstream multiplexed organoids at early, mid and late stages of differentiation (Fig. 1b) were demultiplexed using three state-of-the-art algorithms (demuxlet27, souporcell28, Vireo29).
units.rationale: Provides a comparative baseline for evaluating demultiplexing performance.
